Class OpenWorldPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Canvas
        • Screen
          • OpenWorldPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class OpenWorldPanel
extends Screen
    This class serves as a driver class for the visuals of the open world aspect of this game.

    OpenWorldPanel

    Date: 2016/05/26

    Version:
    1 2016/05/26
    Author:
    David White and Sepehr Hosseini
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setDialogue

        public void setDialogue(Sprite back,
                        java.lang.String text)
        This method sets the dialogue on the screen with the specified text and background.

        Local variables:

        g2D Reference to the Graphics2D class which will be used to draw images onto the screen.

        font The font that the String will be drawn with.

        count This is used for spacing on the dialogue.

        Parameters:
        back - the Sprite that will be used as the dialogue background.
        text - the text to be set on the dialogue.
